SEARCH
Package main.core

Class Port

java.lang.Object
main.core.Port
public class Port extends Object
Represents a port in the system that can be occupied by a device and uses a specific protocol.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Port(Protocol protocol, int portId, String logDir)
    Constructs a new Port with the specified protocol, port ID, and log directory.

  • Constructor Details

    • Port

      public Port(Protocol protocol, int portId, String logDir)
      Constructs a new Port with the specified protocol, port ID, and log directory. Initializes the port and sets up logging for the protocol.
      Parameters:
      protocol - The communication protocol used by the port.
      portId - The unique identifier of the port.
      logDir - The directory where the port logs will be stored.

  • Method Details

    • getProtocol

      public Protocol getProtocol()
      Returns the protocol associated with this port.
      Returns:
      The Protocol used by this port.

    • getDevice

      public Device getDevice()
      Returns the device connected to this port, if any.
      Returns:
      The Device connected to this port, or null if the port is empty.

    • getPortId

      public int getPortId()
      Returns the unique identifier of this port.
      Returns:
      The port ID as an integer.

    • setDevice

      public void setDevice(Device device)
      Sets the device connected to this port.
      Parameters:
      device - The Device to be assigned to this port.

    • isOccupied

      public boolean isOccupied()
      Checks if the port is currently occupied by a device.
      Returns:
      true if the port has a connected device, false otherwise.

    • getStatus

      public String getStatus()
      Returns the status of the port as a formatted string. The status includes the port ID, protocol name, and whether it is occupied or empty.
      Returns:
      A String representing the status of the port.
